feed.title: Home sensors
feed.description:
NOW INACTIVE - after a 6 month spell in use.


A small feed with two sensors - one is a DS18B20 digital temperature sensor while the other is a simple LDR (light-dependent resistor). These are attached to an Arduino with Ethernet shield and a small Linksys WET11 bridge which allows me to place them anywhere in and around the house. Every 15/20 seconds the Arduino reads the sensors and attempts to send the values to Pachube. The DS18B20 provides a direct reading of the temperature while the LDR has been roughly calibrated so that 0 (zero) represents darkness while 250 is for bright light conditions.
[NOTE - location is not my home but simply the middle of the town.]
feed.creator: https://xively.com/users/ccspk
